data.title: Rings of Power Introduces All the Strange, Strange Creatures of Season 2
data.meta_description: Shelob and her spider broods, Ents, sea worms, and more orcs than you can shake a spear at: Amazon's Lord of the Rings prequel is becoming a bit of a creature feature in season 2.
data.text:
Rings of Power really wants us to know that when it comes back next month, it’s going to be doing a lot of the things that fans wished season one had. There’s lots of battles. There’s rings of power, of course. There’s things actually happening instead of our heroes waiting around to realize what the audience did a few episodes in. And there’s going to be aÂ lot of creatures to delight and menace Middle-earth.

Fresh off its banger of a trailer released at Comic-Con, Amazon has now shared a new behind-the-scenes featurette looking at the sheer amount of creatures and monsters that will appear throughout season two. From the armies of Mordor sending legions of orcs (and a rather sizeable Hill-Troll) against the Elves of Eregion, to stomping ents, ghostly Barrow-Wights, and even a giant sea worm in Numenor’s waters, there’s going to be a lot more monstrous action this time around.

Arachnophobes who still watchÂ Return of the King through their fingers beware, however: the featurette also gives us our first look at Isildur’s encounter with a skittering brood of giant spiders… and their mother, Shelob, making herÂ Rings of Power debut.

The potential for Shelob has always been on the table for the series. The descendant of the primal spirit Ungoliantâthe giant spider who destroyed the twinned trees of Valinor at Melkor’s command, which we saw in some of the very first images teased forÂ Rings of PowerâShelob is long-lived enough to be around for quite a big chunk of the Tolkien chronology being covered here. At least we now know that Rings of Power is staying traditional with its depiction of her: no gothic mommy Ã laÂ Shadow of War here.

Rings of Power and its many beasties return to Prime Video on August 29.
